body_html:
You don't need to wait, bazel clean; bazel build should work

On Wed, Aug 10, 2016 at 1:38 PM, patfla notifications@github.com wrote:

bazel clean worked and I now have tensorflow-0.10.0rc0 installed and
running.

How do I tell when bazel clean finishes? I used bazel clean before;
couldn't tell when it finished; and ended up wiping the tree and doing a
git clone again.

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#3699 (comment),
or mute the thread

You don't need to wait, bazel clean; bazel build should work

On Wed, Aug 10, 2016 at 1:38 PM, patfla notifications@github.com wrote:

> bazel clean worked and I now have tensorflow-0.10.0rc0 installed and
> running.
> 
> How do I tell when bazel clean finishes? I used bazel clean before;
> couldn't tell when it finished; and ended up wiping the tree and doing a
> git clone again.
